Release notes

0.4.1

  • Time series in a flow can now be segmented. Each segment maintains its own statistics that will be used by analysis modules. Segments can be defined using:
    • Data values of a time series.
    • Event frames detected earlier in a flow.
  • All items in a data service can now be reset when contributing to it from a flow.

0.4.0

  • Modules in a flow now have a configurable statistics background. Possible backgrounds:
    • Use a background calculated in the current flow evaluation (the default).
    • Use a background that is updated by each evaluation of a flow.
    • Use a background stored in a data service.
  • KPI sets no longer apply to flows. Flows profile and transform the data. Data quality insights are provided by data services.
  • The 'Expose as data service' and 'Expose using Arrow Flight' blocks are no longer available. They are replaced by data services.
  • Python SDK
    • The Python SDK has been modularized. There is no longer one Client class that contained everything, but one class for each concept in Timeseer (.e.g Resources, Flows, DataServices, ...).
    • Event frames returned by de SDK now support time series references that use the IoT data model.
    • Statistics and calculated metadata stored in data services can now be queried.

0.3.9

  • Bad actors of data services are now available in the REST API.

0.3.8

  • Smart interpolation available in filter blocks to impute data in the best possible way.
  • Data sets can be defined in the user interface.
  • Data services
    • automatically generate historical bins based on the chosen time range
    • make data available to consumers (SDK).

0.3.7

  • The order of filters in a filter block can now be changed.
  • Improved formatting of metadata audit trails.
  • Data sets can now be created. A data set contains the data for a specific set of time series in a predefined time period.
  • Series sets can be created based on multiple conditions. It is now possible to only include series with a specific field.

0.3.6

  • Improved univariate and multivariate analysis blocks:
    • Allow configuring a general sensitivity. This influences the number of event frames that are generated.
    • Added "Base on previous evaluation". When this setting is enabled, only new event frames compared to the previous flow evaluation are found by a flow evaluation.
    • Added ranges and default values for module parameters, along with validation.
  • Added a block to create a potentially filtered or interpolated data set.

0.3.5

  • Support for Azure Data Explorer sources.
  • Allow configuring module parameters in the UI.
  • Allow filtering of metadata audit trails by time range.
  • Resources can now be removed using the Python SDK.
  • As an alternative to IIS, a custom reverse proxy that handles HTTPS is now included. SAML support will only be available using this custom reverse proxy in future versions.

0.3.4

  • Allow selection of individual modules in univariate and multivariate blocks.
  • Import and export of resources from and to YAML is now possible.
  • The Python SDK has been extended:
    • Allow creating resources from code, YAML, TOML or JSON.
    • Allow listing all sources exposed by a flow.
    • Uploading data does no longer require a source of type upload. When uploading, a data set will be created. Data sets can be used in flows and series sets.
